programme.title: Baywatch

programme.title: Baywatch

programme.title: Baywatch

programme.title: Henham's Lost Mansions
programme.desc: Tony and the Team help Hektor Rous, the son of 'Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. They are joined by Tudor historian Suzie Lipscomb and buildings expert Richard K. Morriss.

programme.title: Byzantium, Crusaders and Venice
programme.desc: In this episode explore sites that made history. We visit Bryzantium's greatest church, the Haghia Sophia in modern day Istanbul, the Crusaders' greatest fortress, and many more. A true showcase of the Venetian Empire at its peak. Together through these great sites, and others we chart the rise and fall of the great Christian empires of Byzantium, the Crusades and Venice.

programme.title: Ottomans, Mughals and Moors
programme.desc: In the seventh century, a great new religion was born and rose up in the deserts of what is now Saudi Arabia. Within 200 years, the religion had spread throughout the Middle East and North Africa, and even through the Mughal's to India. In this episode of Empire Builders, we explore ten sites that made history as we chart the rise and fall of these great Muslim empires.

programme.title: Grey Nurse
programme.desc: The East Australian Grey Nurse is the only shark in the world that is critically endangered. More than 50% of the animals are carrying hooks and traces from fisherman’s lines. Interaction with humans is endangering this animal.

programme.title: Great White

programme.title: TRP S4:E30 GOLIATH Groupers & Florida Water Issues - FullScale Outdoors
programme.desc: This week I had the chance to sit down with Dale Luginbill of FullScale Outdoors podcast to talk about a number of controversial issues going on in Florida right now. The first of these is the debate on harvesting Goliath grouper. We dig into the positives and negatives of a harvest and expression our opinions. We also discuss the red tide that is taking place in Tampa Bay right now. Is it natural, or something that we have caused. We discuss all of this in today’s show.

programme.title: Guiding Flow S2:E2 “One Community, One Lagoon”

programme.title: Struttinbuck S10:E5 "Illinois Part 1"

programme.title: Struttinbuck S10:E6 "Illinois Part 2"

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E1 "The Hill"

programme.title: Black Cloud S1:E1 "Freelance Hunting the Dakotas"
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell head north to the Dakotas to get a jump on the 2019 duck season with Ed McDonough and friends. Stale weather and too much water make field hunting a bust, but a cold front and a pothole covered in birds quickly changes the tempo and helps the crew ring in the new season in style.

programme.title: Black Cloud S1:E2 "Northern Green | Action Continues in the Dakotas | Black Cloud"
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell continue their freelance trip in the Dakotas. There's an abundance of water, which has the mallards spread out in potholes and flooded fields. In this episode, a couple area students take advantage of a day off from school to share a memorable day in the field with the crew.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: For Chef Shirley Chung, growing up in Beijing, meant everything was dipped in sesame sauce! Here she is reinventing another childhood favorite, lamb kabobs, and transforming it into Beijing Spiced Lamb Chops with Sesame Sauce. And that’s not all, to round out the meal, she is pairing it with homemade Sesame Noodles and a summer corn and jalapeno dish, a nod to her California days.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Chef Keith Corbin is showing off his ability to take southern cuisine favorites and make them new again, as only a professional Chef can, with seasonal ingredients and a few tricks he’s learned along the way. On the menu - Seasonal Spring Vegetable Salad with Honey Berbere Dressing, Fish and Grits, and Ginger & Black Pepper Strawberry Shortcake. This is one for the books!

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Growing up in New York City’s culinary melting pot, gave Chef Jamie Lauren an appreciation of vibrant and bold flavors from an early age. In this episode, she is combining some of her childhood favorites into one epic dish - Flavorful Jerk Chicken is piled high served on fresh corn tortillas with Cuban Style Black Beans, Sweet Plantains, Quick Pickles Onions, and homemade Habanero Hot Sauce.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Steak and potatoes are surely a staple, but in this episode, we get to see how a Chef does this classic pairing. Chef Jason Neroni is showing us how to make his Sweet and Sour Steak and Togarashi Potatoes along with a Marinated Cucumber Salad, Miso Butter Roasted Asparagus, and a Painkiller cocktail.

programme.title: Sourced
programme.desc: Guy takes a trip on the floating markets of Thailand, gathers barnacles on the deadly cliffs of Portugal, and throws a drool-worthy feast in Melbourne.

programme.title: Sourced
programme.desc: Guy discovers that island life is not all ocean swims and sun bathing... at least not while sourcing matcha in Japan, deadly Stone Fish in the Philippines and ingredients for a local feast in Orcas Island.

programme.title: Sourced
programme.desc: Green markets, fish markets, all the markets! Guy heads to Italy, Japan, and the California's Central Coast and discovers where some of the oldest, most sacred and freshest ingredients come from.

programme.title: Sourced
programme.desc: From Sicilian pistachios grown in the shadow of Mount Etna, to an epic feast under the California Redwoods Guy travels to some of the most visually stunning areas in the world to source and cook with amazing ingredients.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie makes three dishes for a party of four, that when combined, are cheaper than just one meal out for brunch. Then, it's a taco party for five people for only $20!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Stale bread, old bananas, canned food, dry foods... they've all gotten a bad wrap, but this is not the end of them yet! Don't let this stuff sit in the pantry, don't let it go to waste - Frankie encourages you to stretch further and cheaper!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Versatility is important. These three items - bacon, eggs, and a whole chicken - will feed you a plethora of delicious meals... and for cheap!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cauliflower is a star and can be transformed into unexpected dishes. Plus it's delicious and nutritious! Frankie reminds us to buy dried-goods in bulk and makes a big chuck roast that stretches over three dishes.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Chef Joe Sasto uses the entire ear of corn to create custom creamy cacio e pepe cavatelli. We’re talking cob, kernel, and husk - and for dessert, he’s making a sweet summery strawberry cobbler that you won’t soon forget.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Chef Stuart O’Keeffe sears up some scallops with smashed crispy fingerlings and roasted tomatoes. He also dishes up an herbed salad, a light and refreshing vodka cocktail, and a fresh and creamy strawberry parfait.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jason Russell - Beige Frosty
programme.desc: Like most comedians, finding a way to be silly in class was a way to get attention from classmates and teachers! Some teachers were amused others had no sense of humor.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Lisa Mills - This is My Real Accent
programme.desc: Lisa Mills is an Atlanta based, award-winning comedian, speaker, and author. Her acting debut was working alongside network television’s favorite military gal, Catherine Bell on the Lifetime Channels hit show, Army Wives.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Moody McCarthy - The Good Jew
programme.desc: Moody was born “Matthew” in Syracuse, NY, into a rambunctious household with six siblings. (They're Irish...somebody had to get a nickname.) He began doing comedy in 1992 and was soon hired by Syracuse’s top morning radio show to cover sports and write jokes, his first loves. After six years of working the road, Moody moved to New York City. This millennium has been good to Moody: he’s also been featured on Last Comic Standing, Star Search (the 2003 reboot), and America’s Got Talent. He’s a regular at the best clubs in the land (including the world famous Comedy Cellar) and can be heard on SiriusXM. Moody’s material is described as original but universal, and smart without being trite. Couple that with a disarming stage presence & in-the-moment chops, you’ll see why he’s earned the admiration of his peers for his ability to “go up cold” and turn any setting into a hot room. From corporate outings to pubs, this versatile performer will brighten any event.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tim Wilkins - Password Protected
programme.desc: Today that dream is more alive than ever as he is a 20-year veteran stand-up comedian, TV and radio personality, speaker and writer, who has performed on stages around the world. He has entertained millions in legendary venues ranging from Radio City Music Hall to chow halls in Afghanistan, to colleges, casinos and cruise ships.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Doug Thompson - Who Taught You What?
programme.desc: With a different look on the everyday life, and the ability to find positive funny analogies on the pitfalls of it all comedian Doug Thompson is a ray of light. He became an opening act for "The Impractical Jokers" from Tru Tv hit show and has never look

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: DC Benny - You Don't Look Funny
programme.desc: Benny lives in Brooklyn where he fiddles around with old Land Rovers when he is supposed to be helping his wife run her natural skincare business. He has a dog named Grits and two cats who prefer that he not share their personal information in this bio.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Larry Omaha - Freaky Times in a Freaky World
programme.desc: Omaha’s insightful view on multi-ethnic America has garnered him numerous tv appearances and places him in great demand. His stories are hailed by the Los Angeles Times as "Refreshing , funny and universal." His side-splitting jabs at the hypocrisy of Am

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Bob Zany - I Think I Handled That Well
programme.desc: He simply reaches into a bottomless grab bag of jokes, so smooth and effortless that it would be easy to overlook just how much talent and skill is behind the process'"

programme.title: Heath Harmison - Raising Insanity
programme.desc: Heath is one of the brightest new comedians out there. His family-friendly style of comedy kills in clubs, colleges, and festivals including the Fringe Festival in Edinburgh, Scotland. You can also find him performing regularly on the Las Vegas Strip at Planet Hollywood, The Tropicana, and the MGM Grand! He has opened for some of the best comics in the business including Brad Garrett, Louie Anderson, Dennis Miller, and Eddie Griffin. His abilities that are presented on stage are endless! From doing celebrity impersonations, to singing, dancing, and accents. Heath's comedy will paint a picture in your mind that will be burned in for weeks or longer. Being an Improv comedian also gives him that extra edge on the standup comedy stage. His quick wit allows him to adapt to any situation. If you have a chance to see Heath Harmison live, TAKE IT.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Bob Stromberg - I'm a Pretty Big Deal
programme.desc: After forty years performing a blend of stand-up, story, and shtick, Bob Stromberg brings his style to the trials of aging.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Alex Velluto - Thirsty
programme.desc: Alex Velluto is a stand-up comedian and Diet Coke drinker from Salt Lake City, Utah. He has performed at comedy festivals all over the country including the Boston Comedy Festival, Big Sky Comedy Festival, and the Seattle International Comedy Competition. He was named “Best of Fest” at the Golden Spike Comedy Festival and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. In 2016, Alex was voted “Best Comedian” by City Weekly Magazine. His debut comedy special “Alex Velluto: Spurious” is currently streaming on Amazon.com.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Christian Pieper - Glutton for Punishment
programme.desc: Christian Pieper is an award-winning and crowd-pleasing comedian from Beaver Dam, Kentucky, now living in Los Angeles. In just five years as a performer, Christian has quickly earned acclaim for his honest, smart, and welcoming approach to personal material, layering unexpectedly subversive observations on current events, culture, and relationships.A two-time semifinalist in the prestigious Boston Comedy Festival, hes also been featured in the Crossroads Comedy Festival, Burbank Comedy Festival, and other festivals and competitions across the country. Christian has also performed abroad, having done shows for troops and civilians in eight different countries, and was a guest on the Bob & Tom show. He currently hosts and produces Adrenaline, a comedy-challenge show presented regularly at Wiseguys Comedy Club in Salt Lake City and the Hollywood Improv.

programme.title: Jason Love - Jokes On Me
programme.desc: One of today's busiest comics, Jason Love has appeared on HBO, Comedy Central, America's Got Talent, and over 20 national broadcasts.Jason works clean and incorporates music, making him a favorite for companies like Google, Chevron, Farmers, and Costco.Says L.A. Weekly: "Jason Love is comedy that brings people together."From the Hollywood Improv to Carolines on Broadway, Jasons audience continues to grow. He has performed overseas for the troops and on the seas for cruise lines. Jason was a finalist at the Cabo Comedy Festival and at the World Series of Comedy in Vegas.Jasons non-profit, Love &amp Laughter, brings free shows to cancer support communities and others in need. His podcast is produced by Levity Entertainment. He is represented by Don Casino Productions.

programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.
